Line 86: Line 86:
== Arrests ==
== Arrests ==
Rights activists have said that security agents have detained a number of protesters who were taking part in the "25th" demonstration. Twenty-five people have been arrested at [[Assiut]]<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut">{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egypt-govt-security-detains-protesters-cairo-and-assiut|title=Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut|publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>. According to Gamal Eid, director of the [[Arab Network for Human Rights Information]] (ANHRI). He noted that security agents seized banners hoisted by the protesters<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. Security sources said that Assuit's police arrested approximately 50 young people the night before "25th" demonstration and confined them in central security trucks<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. Meanwhile, sources at the [[Muslim Brotherhood]], said a number of the groupâs members have been detained in Mohandessin before heading to join "25th" demonstration<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. [[Ayman Nour]], the founder of the liberal opposition [[El-Ghad Party]], has tweeted that his son was taken by an unmarked car.{{Citation needed|date=January 2011}}
Rights activists have said that security agents have detained a number of protesters who were taking part in the "25th" demonstration. Twenty-five people have been arrested at [[Assiut]]<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut">{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egypt-govt-security-detains-protesters-cairo-and-assiut|title=Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut|publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>. According to Gamal Eid, director of the [[Arab Network for Human Rights Information]] (ANHRI). He noted that security agents seized banners hoisted by the protesters<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. Security sources said that Assuit's police arrested approximately 50 young people the night before "25th" demonstration and confined them in central security trucks<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. Meanwhile, sources at the [[Muslim Brotherhood]], said a number of the groupâs members have been detained in Mohandessin before heading to join "25th" demonstration<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. [[Ayman Nour]], the founder of the liberal opposition [[El-Ghad Party]], has tweeted that his son was taken by an unmarked car.{{Citation needed|date=January 2011}}
  +   +
==Mubarak's Family escape==
  +
[[Gamal Mubarak]], Egyptian president Hosni Mubarak's son who is widely tipped as his successor, has fled to [[London]] with his family. Officials did not immediately confirm the report that Gamal Mubarak has fled to the British capital with his wife and daughter aboard a private jet.<ref name="Adnkronos">{{cite web | url=http://www.adnkronos.com/IGN/Aki/English/Security/Egypt-Presidents-son-and-family-have-fled-to-the-UK_311591050596.html|title=Egypt: President's son and family 'have fled to the UK'|accessdate=26 January 2011| date=25 January 2011|publisher=Adnkronos}}</ref><ref name="president's son, family flee to Britain">{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/Egypt-presidents-son-family-flee-to-Britain/articleshow/7365922.cms|title=Egypt president's son, family flee to Britain|accessdate=26 January 2011|date=26 January 2011|publisher=[[The Times of India]]}}</ref><ref name="Beginning of the end">{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/articles/105117/20110126/beginning-of-the-end-for-egypt-s-mubarak-as-son-and-wife-flee.htm|title='Beginning of the end' for Egypt's Mubarak as son and wife flee|accessdate=26 January 2011|date=26 January 2011|publisher=[[International Business Times]]}}</ref>
